name: Sébastien Ogier
bio: Ogier defined the 2010s, winning 6 straight world titles from 2013 to 2018 with Volkswagen and M-Sport Ford. Master of mixed conditions, he's the most complete modern driver.

name: Thierry Neuville
bio: Hyundai’s lead driver for nearly the entire decade, Neuville was runner-up five times and the most consistent challenger to Ogier.

name: Ott Tänak
bio: Aggressively fast and precise, Tänak became Toyota’s ace and won the 2019 WRC title — the first non-French driver to win in 15 years.

name: Elfyn Evans
bio: Evans emerged as a top-tier talent late in the decade, scoring key wins for M-Sport and Toyota with a smooth, risk-aware driving style.

name: Jari-Matti Latvala
bio: A WRC veteran through the 2010s, Latvala raced for Volkswagen and Toyota, collecting wins and setting the record for most rally starts.

name: Andreas Mikkelsen
bio: Often Volkswagen’s third driver, Mikkelsen showed elite pace and skill, scoring podiums and keeping pressure on the lead pack all decade.

name: Hayden Paddon
bio: New Zealand’s rally hero, Paddon scored Hyundai’s first WRC win outside Europe and was a fan favorite with aggressive gravel speed.

name: Esapekka Lappi
bio: Lappi won Rally Finland for Toyota in only his fourth start, becoming one of the most promising new faces of the late 2010s.
